#summary Running Openmeetings [http://junit.org JUnit] tests

= Introduction =

Automatic tests are the significant part of development process. Below is the instruction of how to run Openmeetings [http://junit.org JUnit] tests.


= Details =

  # running tests using command line:
    * all tests:
{{{
ant test
}}}
    * subset of tests by mask:
{{{
ant -Dtestcases=TestError* test
}}}
  # running tests from Eclipse IDE:
    * copy src/META-INF/*yourdb`_`*persistence.xml to src/META-INF/persistence.xml
    * Start Eclipse
    * Load workspace with Openmeetings project (or refresh existing project)
    * Select "Debug Configurations..."
http://openmeetings.googlecode.com/svn/docs/junit/DebugConfigurations.png
    * Create New Junit configuration, give it a name and select test class
http://openmeetings.googlecode.com/svn/docs/junit/NewConfiguration.png
    * Select Arguments tab
    * Add the following code to the VM section
{{{
-javaagent:${workspace_loc:ROOT}/lib/openjpa2/openjpa-2.1.0.jar -Dwebapps.root=__<FULL PATH TO OPENMEETINGS>__\dist\red5\webapps\openmeetings
}}}
http://openmeetings.googlecode.com/svn/docs/junit/Arguments.png
    * Select Debug
